commentary_central: The Fed eases again as it seeks to get to neutral faster
commentary_higher: The Fed holds rates in response to persistently above target inflation data and no further bad news on the labour market
commentary_lower: The Fed votes for a jumbo cut in the face of another sharp labour market deterioration

commentary_central: The Fed takes another step towards neutral in the absence of significant changes in labour market or inflation data
commentary_higher: Rising inflation as companies pass through tariffs forces the Fed into one hold
commentary_lower: The Fed delivers at least one jumbo cut as economic activity falls sharply

commentary_central: The Fed continues to reduce rates at a quarterly pace
commentary_higher: Persistently high inflation forces the Fed to reduce rates at a slower pace
commentary_lower: Economic weakness forces the Fed to move the policy stance into accommodative territory

commentary_central: Fed continues path of easing to neutral or just below
commentary_higher: Inflationary policies require interest rates to stay higher or rise
commentary_lower: Weakness in real economy leads to faster pace of cuts or a lower estimate of neutral rates

commentary_central: The Fed gradually brings the benchmark rate back to neutral, after taking it below neutral levels in 2026
commentary_higher: The Fed is forced to remain cautious as inflation rises to well above target as a result of tariffs
commentary_lower: Political pressures or weak demand force the Fed to retain an accommodative stance

commentary_central: The Fed gradually brings the benchmark rate back to neutral, after taking it below neutral levels in 2026
commentary_higher: The Fed is forced to remain cautious as inflation rises to well above target as a result of tariffs
commentary_lower: Political pressures or weak demand force the Fed to retain an accommodative stance

commentary_central: Interest rates converge on a rate similar to the long-term trend growth of the US economy plus inflation, although the path towards these rates might be bumpy with long periods outside the range.
commentary_higher: Strong growth or a growing lack of confidence in US public finances requires a higher neutral interest rate.
commentary_lower: Weak and persistently low growth generates few outside options for savings, helping the longer-term interest rate to fall to low levels.

commentary_central: Rates remain on hold with inflation at target and positive signs of economic activity
commentary_higher: The ECB is very unlikely to reverse course so soon after easing
commentary_lower: Another shock emerges from either trade or other geopolitical considerations and the ECB cuts in response

commentary_central: The ECB maintains rates in the middle of its estimate of the neutral range
commentary_higher: A rate rise just as the easin cycle appears to have ended is extremely unlikely
commentary_lower: The ECB is forced to cut again as a downside shock to the economy or inflation materialises

commentary_central: The ECB keeps rates close to neutral as a strong pick-up in consumption keeps inflation at target
commentary_higher: Higher-than-expected inflationary pressures force the ECB to keep rates slightly above neutral territory
commentary_lower: The ECB delivers additional rate cuts after persistently weak consumption and an unfavourable international environment raise the risks of undershooting.

commentary_central: The ECB keeps rates close to but below neutral as a mild pick-up in consumption keeps inflation at target
commentary_higher: The ECB keeps rates around neutral as a strong pick-up in consumption keeps inflation at target
commentary_lower: The ECB delivers additional rate cuts after persistently weak consumption and an unfavourable international environment raise the risks of undershooting.

commentary_central: The path of ECB rates in 2027 will become clearer over the next 12-months
commentary_higher: The path of ECB rates in 2027 will become clearer over the next 12-months
commentary_lower: The path of ECB rates in 2027 will become clearer over the next 12-months

commentary_central: The path of ECB rates in 2027 will become clearer over the next 12-months
commentary_higher: The path of ECB rates in 2027 will become clearer over the next 12-months
commentary_lower: The path of ECB rates in 2027 will become clearer over the next 12-months

commentary_central: Interest rates converge on a rate similar to the expected inflation rate and lower than nominal GDP.
commentary_higher: More potential investment opportunity or an uplift in productivity would require a higher neutral interest rate.
commentary_lower: Weak potential output and persistently low investment generate few outside options for savings, helping the long-term interest rate to fall to low levels.

commentary_central: The BoE decides to pause rate cuts, wanting to see more progress on disinflation before it continues with graudal and cautious easing of policy
commentary_higher: The BoE raises rates in the highly unlikely scenario of a a sudden outbreak of inflation in the run up to the meeting
commentary_lower: The MPC chooses to contine with quarterly cuts, judging that sufficient progress on disinflation has happened

commentary_central: The BoE delivers four cuts in 2025 as it eases policy towards a more neutral rate gradually and carefully
commentary_higher: Concerns about the persistence of inflation leaves the MPC on pause for the rest of 2025
commentary_lower: The UK economy weakens, requiring the BoE to stimulate demand

commentary_central: Inflation is on course to fall back to target by the end of 2026 and the bank continues slow loosening
commentary_higher: The BoE wants to ease back to neutral more slowly, holding rates higher for longer
commentary_lower: Weak growth or an external shock forces the bank to cut rates to stimulate the economy and keep unemployment in check

commentary_central: Inflation appears on track to hit target in a sustainable way the bank feels its way towards neutral, but is not there yet
commentary_higher: Inflation remains above target forcing the bank to hold rates higher for longer and reconsider estimates of the neutral rate
commentary_lower: Weak growth or an external shock forces the bank to cut rates to stimulate the economy and keep unemployment in check

commentary_central: Inflation has hit target in a sustainable way and the bank achieves neutral rates
commentary_higher: Inflation remains above target forcing the bank to hold rates higher for longer and reconsider estimates of the neutral rate
commentary_lower: Weak growth or an external shock forces the bank to cut rates to stimulate the economy and keep unemployment in check

commentary_central: Inflation has hit target in a sustainable way and the BoE has achieved a broadly neutral interest rate
commentary_higher: Inflation remains above target forcing the bank to hold rates higher for longer and reconsider estimates of the neutral rate
commentary_lower: Weak growth or an external shock forces the bank to cut rates to stimulate the economy and keep unemployment in check

commentary_central: Interest rates converge on a rate similar to the expected inflation rate and lower than nominal GDP, due to stronger public finances and lower potential growth rates. The path towards these rates might be bumpy with long periods outside the range. Hence the low probability for a central scenario.
commentary_higher: Stronger growth or a growing lack of confidence in UK public finances would require a higher neutral interest rate. Strong growth because plentiful potential alternative investments allow savers to demand higher returns and weak public finances because government needs to attract more savings.
commentary_lower: Weak growth and persistently low investment generates few outside options for savings, helping the longer-term interest rate to fall to low levels.

commentary_central: The BoJ is able to take the next step to rate normalisation, armed with new economic and inflation forecasts
commentary_lower: Caution at the BoJ due to macroeconomic and political uncertainty keeps rates on hold

commentary_central: After raising in October, the BoJ holds rates steady in December.
commentary_higher: The BoJ raises rates faster due to a much weaker yen, or faster growth and stronger indications of a wage-price cycle
commentary_lower: The BoJ remains cautious, maintaining rates with a view to an early rate rise at the start of 2026

commentary_central: The BoJ assesses that wage growth inflation trends are on track following spring wage negotiations and continues to push rates slowly higher
commentary_higher: The BoJ seeks a faster path to neutral as wage and price increases pick up faster than expected
commentary_lower: The BoJ holds rates due to weaker wage and inflation developments or increased risks from an external shock

commentary_central: The BoJ assesses that wage growth inflation trends are on track and achieves the mid point of our neutral rates range
commentary_higher: The BoJ becomes confident that wages and prices will reinforce one another and seeks a more normal range for interest rates
commentary_lower: The BoJ holds rates due to weaker wage and inflation developments or increased risks from an external shock

commentary_central: The BoJ assesses that wage growth and inflation are on track and achieves the midpoint of our neutral rates range
commentary_higher: The BoJ becomes confident that wages and prices will reinforce one another and seeks a more normal range for interest rates
commentary_lower: The BoJ holds rates lower due to weaker wage and inflation developments or increased risks from an external shock such as trade tariffs

commentary_central: The BoJ assesses that wage growth and inflation are on track and achieves the midpoint of our neutral rates range
commentary_higher: The BoJ becomes confident that wages and prices will reinforce one another and seeks a more normal range for interest rates
commentary_lower: The BoJ holds rates lower due to weaker wage and inflation developments or increased risks from an external shock such as trade tariffs

commentary_central: Interest rates converge on a relatively low neutral rate.
commentary_higher: A successful emergence from decades of weak growth and inflation would require higher neutral interest rates.
commentary_lower: Japan falls back into its low inflation trap, failing to generate domestic inflation and wage growth.
